ENTRY       EC 4.1.2.47                 Enzyme
NAME        (S)-hydroxynitrile lyase;
            (S)-cyanohydrin producing hydroxynitrile lyase;
            (S)-oxynitrilase;
            (S)-HbHNL;
            (S)-MeHNL;
            hydroxynitrile lyase;
            oxynitrilase;
            HbHNL;
            MeHNL;
            (S)-selective hydroxynitrile lyase;
            (S)-cyanohydrin carbonyl-lyase (cyanide forming)
CLASS       Lyases;
            Carbon-carbon lyases;
            Aldehyde-lyases
SYSNAME     (S)-cyanohydrin lyase (cyanide forming)
REACTION    (1) an aliphatic (S)-hydroxynitrile = cyanide + an aliphatic aldehyde or ketone;
            (2) an aromatic (S)-hydroxynitrile = cyanide + an aromatic aldehyde [RN:R09359]
ALL_REAC    R09359;
            (other) R01409 R02811
SUBSTRATE   aliphatic (S)-hydroxynitrile;
            aromatic (S)-hydroxynitrile
PRODUCT     cyanide [CPD:C01326];
            aliphatic aldehyde;
            aliphatic ketone;
            aromatic aldehyde [CPD:C00193]
COMMENT     Hydroxynitrile lyases catalyses the the cleavage of hydroxynitriles into cyanide and the corresponding aldehyde or ketone. In nature the liberation of cyanide serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores and microbial attack in plants. In vitro the enzymes from Manihot esculenta and Hevea brasiliensis accept a broad range of aliphatic and aromatic carbonyl compounds as substrates and catalyse the formation of (S)-hydroxynitriles [1,10].
HISTORY     EC 4.1.2.47 created 2011
